abstract: A slowdown in the pace of growth of China’s economy is leading foreign investors to reassess the country as a destination for their money.
snippet: A slowdown in the pace of growth of China’s economy is leading foreign investors to reassess the country as a destination for their money.
lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — On a tour of central Henan Province in May of last year, China’s president, Xi Jinping, first raised the notion of the economy adjusting to a “new normal.” Eight months later, with the economy growing at its slowest pace in more than two decades, it is increasingly clear what this adjustment will mean for China.

headline.main: To Invest, or Not, as China Shifts
